text:
Before we update account we wonder if this is possible:
Can product creates/updates on HubSpot be used to trigger actions in automation workflows?

Hello everyone,
Is there any possibility to send customized data (as an array or object of elements) using an API to use it in an email that will be sent from a workflow?
:wave: Hi everyone! I am new here, I am adding new integration which is not available in the market place. I have generated API key but what is the endpoint for HubSpot?

Hi all, am in need of some advice on Workflows.
Basically we have many custom properties which we want to push through a workflow to do a POST to an external system if those properties are updated.
We currently have a workflow that has all of those custom properties in a enrolment trigger, but as there are so many and more are likely to be added too, the HubSpot workflow when editing it is becoming so large the pages stops responding and I am worried that it's not sustainable to keep adding to it without breaking HubSpot in someway.
I can't use the Last Modified HubSpot field, as this causes users to go into the workflow for every minor change to the accounts for fields we don't care about. Struggling to figure out a better solution to monitoring the fields we do care about.
Hello everyone! I have a question... when I make a request using the product endpoint to create one, returns me i haven`t the e-commerce scope, but i have, i'm using the default body params
That's a great idea even bring some other communities.
Let’s discuss! I’m out right now with post-INBOUND Covid alas, but would love to discuss what you have in mind and see how we can support it! Next week sometime?

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!
Is anyone else not able to log into HubSpot because of a CORS issue?
Back up now

Hey everyone!! Im new to this slack community.. Im currently working on a site built in HubSpot. If i have HubL / module questions for that where is the best place to ask? I dont want to spam channels lol

<#C2YH119N2|hubl> <#CFPRTEGTX|modules>

What do you mean by mirror? For example `{`
        `name: "hs_product_id",`
        `value: Product.objectid,`
      `},`
      `{`
        `name: "quantity",`
        `value: Product.quantity,`
      `},`
      `{`
        `name: "closedate",`
        `value: Product.enddate,`
      `},`
      `{`
        `name: "opendate",`
        `value: Product.startdate,`
      `},`
      `{`
        `name: "unitcost",`
        `value: 123,`
      `},`
    `];`
unit cost will not work nor will the dates

Hello everyone, I am new to this and I just wanted to ask one question.
Is there a way for me to split an active list into further equal active lists via code or any other method.
If yes, would someone be wiling to share the code?
Is there anyway to access this "made on" date via API for object property changes?

hey guys,

I am trying to extract the data from all deals in the HubSpot, it extracts some information but not all of them,

```import requests
import json
import urllib
import csv
# Set your variables
max_results = 3100
access_token = 'my_access_token'
limit = 100
deal_list = []
get_all_deals_url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals>"
# Set up the headers, including the OAuth 2.0 access token
headers = {
    'Authorization': f'Bearer {access_token}',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}
# Set up the initial parameters
parameter_dict = {
    'limit': limit,
}
while True:
    # Make the API request
    response = requests.get(get_all_deals_url, headers=headers, params=parameter_dict)
    # Check if the request was successful
    if response.status_code == 200:
        # Parse the JSON response
        data = response.json()
        # Print the first deal data to inspect the structure
        if data['results']:
            print(json.dumps(data['results'][0], indent=4))
        deal_list.extend(data['results'])
        # Check if there are more pages
        if data.get('paging', {}).get('next', {}).get('after'):
            parameter_dict['after'] = data['paging']['next']['after']
        else:
            break
    else:
        # If the request was not successful, print the error
        print(f"Failed to retrieve deals: {response.status_code}")
        print(response.text)
        break
# Extract the necessary properties and write to a CSV
with open('deals.csv', 'w', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as output_file:
    writer = csv.writer(output_file)
    writer.writerow(['id', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'deal_name', 'is_archived'])  # Header
    for deal in deal_list:
        deal_id = deal.get('id')
        created_at = deal.get('createdAt')
        updated_at = deal.get('updatedAt')
        deal_name = deal.get('properties', {}).get('dealname')
        is_archived = deal.get('archived')
        writer.writerow([deal_id, created_at, updated_at, deal_name, is_archived])```

this is the example of an output,

```{
    "id": ".........",
    "properties": {
        "amount": "4342",
        "closedate": "2019-10-22T06:00:00Z",
        "createdate": "2018-10-04T07:00:00Z",
        "dealname": "A Good Timeout - New Deal",
        "dealstage": "closedlost",
        "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2019-10-09T06:15:20.930Z",
        "hs_object_id": ".......",
        "pipeline": "default"
    },
    "createdAt": "2020-10-05T07:00:00Z",
    "updatedAt": "2023-09-06T06:15:20.930Z",
    "archived": false
}```
but it does not return the source of a deal property named ‘billing effective date’.

Please help:)
Sorry, does anyone know which PM works on the quotes, deals, and payments?
Need to discuss approvals
